translation: First, please take a look at the pictures on the screen.
transcript: 我想先请大家看一看上面的图片。

translation: Some pictures about paragliding.
transcript: 这是一些滑翔伞的图片。

translation: What are the first words that come to your mind at this point?
transcript: 我想问一下这个时候在大家脑海里反应出来的词是什么？

translation: Cool, free!
transcript: 酷、自由!

translation: Yes, paragliding is a sport that can set you free.
transcript: 对，滑翔伞是一项非常非常自由的运动。

translation: Imagine that we are flying at an altitude of 1000 meters, when the blue sky and white clouds are at your back and below you is the vast expanse of the land.
transcript: 假想一下，我们飞翔在一千米的高空，这个时候你背后是蓝天白云，而你下面是一望无垠的大地。

translation: At this time, I think you can imagine the feeling of flying high up in the sky.
transcript: 这时候我想大家都能够想象得到那种真正的天高任鸟飞的感觉。

translation: My first contact with the paragliding was due to one of my friends.
transcript: 我最开始接触滑翔伞是源自于我的一个朋友。

translation: One day he called me and said, “Zhuohuan, I’m injured, and I’m going to be discharged from the hospital today. Could you come and give me a hand?”
transcript: 有一天他给我打电话说：“卓桓我受伤了，今天要出院，你能不能来接我一下？”

translation: So I went to Jishuitan Hospital, the best orthopedic hospital in Beijing, to pick up my friend.
transcript: 于是我就到了全北京最好的骨科医院，积水潭医院。

translation: I saw him on crutches with a leg in plaster.
transcript: 我看到了一个拄着双拐，有一条腿打了石膏的我的这个兄弟。

translation: My friend said that the accident took place when he was flying a paraglider.
transcript: 我的这个兄弟说他是因为飞滑翔伞。

translation: When he tried to land, there wasn’t enough height, and he had to make a forced landing in the midair.
transcript: 在回到降落场着陆的时候，因为没有足够的高度在半路迫降。

translation: Then he fell to the asphalt road from five meters above, and broke a leg.
transcript: 那么在五米的时候呢，摔落到了油柏马路上，摔坏了一条腿。

translation: I was stunned when I heard the word of “paragliding”, as I could never refuse such a fun sport!
transcript: 那么当时我听到滑翔伞这两个字的时候，我的眼睛就直了，因为这么好玩儿的一个运动我一定要去玩儿！

translation: So I rushed to sign up at a paragliding club the next day.
transcript: 所以第二天我就去滑翔伞俱乐部报了名。

translation: The paragliding club first gave us an initial training.
transcript: 滑翔伞俱乐部最开始学习呢，会给我们来初级培训。

translation: It was actually very simple, as we just learnt some basic knowledge of flying a paraglider.
transcript: 初级培训其实很简单，会告诉我们一些滑翔伞基本的飞翔知识。

translation: In simple terms, a paraglider is made up of two pieces of cloth that are sewn up above our head and a piece of cloth at the bottom to hold us, and all are linked with a few ropes.
transcript: 那么简单来说，滑翔伞是由我们头顶上的两块缝起来的布，以及我们屁股下面一块会兜住我们自己的布，用很多根绳子连起来构成的。

translation: Among these ropes, there are two important ropes on the left and right side respectively that should be held tight in our hands, as they are used to control brakes.
transcript: 在这些绳子里面呢，左边有一根右边有一根非常重要的两根绳子会抓在我们手里，叫做刹车绳。

translation: Their function is also very simple.
transcript: 它的功能也很简单。

translation: When I pull the left brake rope, the speed on the left will get slower, enabling me to turn left; if I pull the right rope, I will turn right.
transcript: 就是当我拉下左手刹车绳的时候，左边的速度就变慢了，那么我就会向左转，如果我拉下右手的绳子的话呢，我就会向右转。

translation: How time flies! In the initial training process, we learnt the basic paragliding skills mainly on the ground.
transcript: 在初级培训过程中时间过得很快，主要要掌握基本的滑翔技巧，那么主要还是在地面上掌握了。

translation: When I was about to finish my elementary courses, we went to a hill, a 50-meter-high mound, to test paragliding flight.
transcript: 初级班毕业的时候呢，我记得很清楚我们是去了一个大约五十米高的山山丘上面，一个土包吧，50米高的土包上面去试飞。

translation: Then we walked on the hill, spreading out the paraglider against the wind.
transcript: 那么我们就背着伞走到了这个土包上面，把伞迎着山坡的风铺开。

translation: When there was wind blowing which is suitable for flying, we would pull up the paraglider and it would be lifted with the wind.
transcript: 有合适的风吹过来的时候呢，我们就把伞拉起来，因为伞在风吹的过程中会产生升力，那么它就会升起来。

translation: We had to make sure it was indeed on top of my head.
transcript: 我们要保证它确实在我的头顶。

translation: When the paraglider was on top of my head, I ran straight down the hill.
transcript: 那么当伞在我的头顶的时候呢，我就顺着这个山坡儿一直往下跑。

translation: As I ran faster, the lift force generated by the winds got greater than my weight.
transcript: 随着我跑动速度的加快，伞翼产生的升力会大于我身体的重力。

translation: So I flew off the hillside probably halfway I ran.
transcript: 那么大概跑到一半的时候我就会脱离山坡飞起来了。

translation: I clearly remember that I didn’t fly up high that time, only about five meters high, and I didn’t fly long, presumably five seconds, but that was one of the most impressive paragliding experiences in my life.
transcript: 我清楚地记得那次我飞的高度不高，大约只有五米；飞的时间也不长，大概有五秒钟，但是那是我有生以来印象最深刻的一次飞行经历之一。

translation: Because I really experienced that my feet left the ground, I was flying, and I could control my flight.
transcript: 因为那个时候我是真真正正地感觉到自己双脚离开了地面，我是在飞行，我自己能够控制的飞行。

translation: After flying over the hill, the coach would take us to fly over the mountain.
transcript: 那么飞过小山之后，教练会继续带我们去飞大山。

translation: And this time, we couldn’t fly by ourselves, as we had to learn a lot of stuff in the air that we haven’t known before.
transcript: 而飞大山的第一次就不能自己去飞了，因为我们需要在空中了解很多第一次在空中以前所不知道的事情。

translation: For instance, he took us to Mang Mountain in Beijing, paragliding from 500-meter mountaintop.
transcript: 譬如说我们会去北京的莽山山顶有五百米高，他带着我从莽山上飞起来。

translation: In the air, he told me that the Ming Tombs Reservoir was just ahead, and there was massive turbulence over the hill on the right front and we should avoid it, take a detour, and fly straight forward.
transcript: 那他会告诉我说前面是十三陵水库，那么右前方有一个小山包这里面有很多的乱流，不要过去，要绕过去，所以我们要先向前飞。

translation: Then looking further to the right, we saw a large lawn.
transcript: 那么再往右看的时候，我们就会看到地面上有一个很大的草坪。

translation: That was our landing site.
transcript: 这里就是我们的降落场。

translation: The coach flew with me once to help to acquaint me with the route, and finally landed on the destination.
transcript: 教练会带着我飞一次航线，最后落到降落场。

translation: Afterwards, we will go for intermediate training, as my goal is to really fly up in the air, and the intermediate training will tell us some more fundamental flying knowledge.
transcript: 经过带飞之后呢，我们就要去学习中级培训，因为我的目标是要真正的上天飞行，那中级培训会告诉我们一些更基本的飞行知识。

translation: For example, the air traffic rules.
transcript: 比如说在天空中我们的交通规则。

translation: If two gliders fly towards each other, how to avoid collision?
transcript: 如果有两个爱好者相向而飞的话，如何避免碰撞呢？

translation: Very easy, pass on the right side.
transcript: 很简单，右侧通行。

translation: In addition to the air traffic rules, what we need to learn is how to gain power while paragliding.
transcript: 那么除了交通规则以外，我们还需要学习的就是滑翔伞在大自然中如何获取动力。

translation: We know that a paraglider doesn’t generate power itself.
transcript: 我们知道滑翔伞本身是没有任何动力的。

translation: So in the process of flying, we can only rely on two airflows to ensure we fly as high as we can.
transcript: 那么在飞行的过程中，我们只能依靠两种方法让自己能够不是飞得越来越低，而是飞得越来越高。

translation: The first is the dynamic airflow.
transcript: 第一种方法就是动力气流。

translation: What is the dynamic airflow?
transcript: 什么是动力气流呢？

translation: That is wind as we usually say.
transcript: 我们可以理解为平时我们说的风。

translation: Usually a wind blows horizontally.
transcript: 平时的风会平着吹。

translation: But when it meets a hillside, the hillside will push the wind to go up.
transcript: 但是如果它遇到一个山坡的话，风吹过来吹到山坡上，山坡会促使这个风向上走。

translation: At this time, if we fly above the hillside, we can imagine that the wind will blow us higher and higher.
transcript: 这时候如果我们在山坡上面来飞行，我们可以想象得到，风会把我们吹得越来越高。

translation: This kind of airflow is called dynamic airflow.
transcript: 这种气流我们称之为是动力气流。

translation: Another type of airflow we can rely on is called thermal.
transcript: 另外一种气流我们能够借用的就是叫做热气流。

translation: The principle of thermal is basically related to the fact of solar power heating the ground.
transcript: 热气流的原理基本上是和太阳能加热地面有关。

translation: When the ground is heated by solar power, the surface temperature rises, pushing up the air temperature.
transcript: 当地面被太阳能加热之后，地面的温度升高将地表的空气温度升高。

translation: When the air expands with heat, it starts to rise.
transcript: 那么空气热胀冷缩它就会开始上浮。

translation: When the air starts to rise, we will be lifted up by the thermal if we are paragliding above it.
transcript: 当地面有空气开始上浮时，我们的滑翔伞如果在这上面飞，就会被从地面升起的空气顶起来。

translation: These are the two basic ways for paragliders to be powered.
transcript: 那么这两种方式就是滑翔伞获取动力的两种基本方式。

translation: I can still remember that when I first took off from the Mang Mountain, I flew higher and higher by means of the dynamic airflow.
transcript: 我还清楚地记得，当我第一次在莽山起飞场上飞起来，然后在山坡上借助动力气流越飞越高，越飞越高。

translation: And when I overlooked the take-off field, I was very excited and astonished, as I flew with the power of nature.
transcript: 当我能够俯视起飞场，我当时的心情真是非常非常的激动，因为这是我借助大自然的力量在上升。

translation: While enjoying freedom and happiness in the air, gliders must pay the most attention to avoid accidents.
transcript: 而飞行员飞到这个阶段，在享受自由和快乐的同时，最需要注意的一点就是如何避免安全事故。

translation: There are two accidents that I can recall clearly.
transcript: 在我印象里面有两起印象最深刻的安全事故。

translation: One was man-made misfortune, and the other was natural calamity.
transcript: 它们一起可以称之称之为是人祸，而另外一起可以叫做是天灾。

translation: The former accident happened in 1999, and we called it the “April 28th Accident”.
transcript: 人祸这一次是这样子的，那是在1999年，我们称它为428天安门事件。

translation: That day, Mr. Gao Xingzhe, a coach from Beijing Hualian Club, took off from the top of the Mang Mountain near the Ming Tombs Reservoir, which is a common take-off site for us.
transcript: 那天是北京的华联俱乐部的教练高兴哲，他在北京十三陵水库旁边的莽山，就是我们经常飞伞的地方在山顶起飞。

translation: After taking off, Mr. Gao made a decision.
transcript: 高兴哲教练在起飞之后呢，他做了一个决定。

translation: As he was perhaps in a good mood, he hoped that he could fly a paraglider over the city of Beijing.
transcript: 他那天可能心情很好，所以他希望自己能够从莽山山顶起飞之后，驾驶滑翔伞飞越北京城。

translation: It happened to be the north wind blowing, so he kept flying south from the Ming Tombs Reservoir in the north of Beijing.
transcript: 当天正好是北风，所以他借着风力从北京北侧的十三陵水库一直向南飞。

translation: After flying over the fourth and the third ring roads, unfortunately he didn’t have enough thermal to keep his height.
transcript: 飞过了四环三环，可是不幸的是他进了三环之后并没有足够多的热气流来补充高度。

translation: Then he gradually descended, and it was only a few hundred meters above the ground when he flew into the second ring.
transcript: 这个时候他的高度不断地降低，飞到二环里面的时候就只有几百米了。

translation: When he found himself only 200 meters high above the ground, he was just over the Forbidden City, and the only place that he could choose to land was Tian’anmen Square.
transcript: 当他发现自己只有两百米高度的时候，他当时所处的位置是正处在故宫的上方，他当时唯一可以选择的降落场只有一个地方：天安门广场。

translation: Then he had no choice but to make a landing near the Monument to the People's Heroes in Tian’anmen Square.
transcript: 所以他只好迫降在了天门广场的英雄纪念碑旁边。

translation: Once he fell to the Monument to the People's Heroes, he was immediately brought down by the policemen from all directions.
transcript: 他落在纪念碑旁边之后，马上就被从四面八方冒出来的警察摁倒在地。

translation: Then it took him great efforts to explain to the police that he wasn’t thrown away from the plane!
transcript: 接下来他就花了很大的力气向这些警察叔叔们解释：我不是被飞机从天上扔下来的。

translation: He also needed to explain to the police that he didn’t hide the engine, as the policemen didn’t believe he could fly from far away without power.
transcript: 第二个问题他还要解释：我没有把发动机藏起来，因为警察叔叔不相信他在无动力的情况下能够从很远的地方飞过来。

translation: This paragliding brought him a personal record.
transcript: 那么这次飞行给他带来一个个人记录。

translation: He flew a total of two hours, with the maximum height of 3000 meters and the straight line distance of 50 kilometers.
transcript: 总共飞行的时间历时两小时，他飞行的最高高度有三千米，飞行的直线距离有五十公里。

translation: With this record, Gao ended his flying career, because he was immediately banned for flying for life and was detained for 15 days, and at the meantime his paragliding club was disbanded.
transcript: 那么随着这个记录呢，他也结束了自己的飞行生涯，因为他随即即被终身禁赛，还有拘留十五天，同时他的滑翔伞俱乐部也被解散了。

translation: Though it is free to fly, it doesn’t mean it has no boundary.
transcript: 所以飞行虽然是自由的，但是也不是有边界的。

translation: The second accident was caused by natural disasters.
transcript: 那么我我想到的第二个事故呢，是来自于天灾。

translation: It happened some time in 2007 in Australia, where a global paragliding tournament was held.
transcript: 这次事情发生在2007年的澳大利亚，那是澳大利亚当年的一场全球滑翔伞锦标赛。

translation: Halfway through the game, a dark cloud suddenly moved from a distance.
transcript: 比赛进行到一半的时候，忽然从远处飞来了一片乌云。

translation: It was so dark, as it was very thick and thick enough to block all the sunlight.
transcript: 这种云彩它的特点是很黑，之所以很黑是因为它很厚，很厚才能挡住所有的光。

translation: A cumulonimbus cloud is like a big vacuum cleaner that sucks everything below it, so this kind of cloud often causes hazard when paragliding.
transcript: 一个积雨云就像一个很大的吸尘器，会非常强烈地吸起它下面的东西，所以这种云彩对滑翔伞运动是非常有害的。

translation: If a paraglider is unfortunately caught by the cloud, it will be difficult to escape as the speed reaches 10 to 20 meters per second.
transcript: 如果滑翔伞不幸被云彩吸住的话，这种每秒十米到每秒二十米的速度基本上很难逃脱。

translation: So when the cloud flew over, all the paragliders chose to give up.
transcript: 所以当这个云彩飞过来的时候，后面几乎所有的滑翔伞运动员都选择了放弃。

translation: However, Eva from Germany and He from China still hoped to continue the game, as they didn’t want to throw away their chance to win.
transcript: 而这时来自德国的Eva以及来自于中国的老何，他们两个还希望继续比赛，他们不希望放弃这个比赛的机会。

translation: They hoped they could catch up with the foregoers before the dark cloud arrives.
transcript: 所以他们希望在乌云来到之前能够绕过乌云赶上飞在前面的先头部队。

translation: Unfortunately, the dark cloud flew faster than they flew, and both of them were sucked into the cloud.
transcript: 然而遗憾的是云彩飞过来的速度比他们飞行的速度快很多，他们两人双双地被吸入了乌云的内部。

translation: Eva was sucked up to a height of 10,000 meters at a speed of 20 meters per second and the temperature there was only about minus 50 degrees.
transcript: Eva被以每秒二十米的速度吸到了高达1万米的高空，那里边的温度大概只有零下50度。

translation: She was frozen and fainted during the ascent, and was thrown out of the dark cloud when she woke up.
transcript: 不过她幸运的是在上升的过程中她被冻晕过去了，呵，当她醒过来的时候她已经被云彩抛出了积雨云。

translation: With the height dropping and the temperature climbing, she slowly regained consciousness and manipulated the paraglider to land.
transcript: 随着高度的下降温度的上升，她慢慢地恢复了知觉，操纵着滑翔伞迫降了。

translation: The following physical examination showed she only had minor frostbite and no life-threatening injuries.
transcript: 迫降之后经过检查她只有轻微的冻伤，并没有生命危险。

translation: However, He wasn’t that lucky.
transcript: 然而老何就没有这么幸运了。

translation: After he was sucked into a height of 6000 meters by the cumulonimbus cloud, he was unfortunately struck by lightning and died on the spot.
transcript: 老何被积雨云吸到了六千米的高空之后，不幸遭遇雷击，当场丧生。

translation: Why were they at risk?
transcript: 他们为什么会遇到危险呢？

translation: Because they violated the rules.
transcript: 是因为他们违反了规则。

translation: The paragliding rules clearly stipulate that first, you can only fly in the designated airspace; secondly, don’t fly under adverse weather conditions, especially when there are cumulonimbus clouds, as they are very dangerous and often can be fatal.
transcript: 滑翔伞飞行里面有清楚的规则规定，首先只能在允许的空域里面飞行，其次天气不好一定不要飞行，尤其是积雨云，积雨云非常的危险，很多时候都会致命。

translation: Paragliding accidents occur every year, and most of them happen because gliders violate the rules of the flight.
transcript: 每年滑翔伞都会出一些事故，在这些事故中绝大部分它的产生，都只是因为我们飞行员没有遵守飞行规则。

translation: In fact, rules exist in every aspect of our lives.
transcript: 其实规则存在于我们生活中的很多环节之中。

translation: Every time we prepare to enter a new sector or to do something new, we have to know its rules, and then we can devote ourselves into it and enjoy the freedom and happiness brought by it.
transcript: 我们每要进入一个新的行业或者要做一件新事，其实我们都必须要了解这个事情里面蕴含着什么样的规则，然后我们才有可能去进入里面享受做这件事而带来的自由和快乐。

translation: Whether we enter a country or an industry, or just write a program or perform as an actor, we have to follow tons of rules.
transcript: 无论是我们大到进入一个国家、进入一个行业，还是小到去写一段程序或者去做一个演员，我们要遵循很多很多的规则。

translation: For example, culturally speaking, it is natural for a child to call his father's name in the United States.
transcript: 比如说，从文化上讲，在美国孩子直呼父亲的名字是很自然的一件事情。

translation: However, in the rural areas of northeast China, if a child dares to call his father's name, people may get very angry.
transcript: 但是在中国东北的农村，如果孩子敢直呼父亲的名字，可能大家都会非常生气。

translation: And if we are going to an Islamic country, some behaviors may even bring danger to our lives, if we are not informed of their culture in advance.
transcript: 而如果我们要去一个伊斯兰国家，如果没有提前了解好很多文化的话，一些行为甚至会给我们带来生命危险。

translation: In life, we must abide by many such rules.
transcript: 在生活中，我们必须遵守很多这样的规则。

translation: Only by obeying the rules can we enjoy the happiness and freedom brought by the rules.
transcript: 我们只有遵守了规则，才能够享受由规则带来的快乐和自由。

translation: So what I want to say is that let us follow the rules to fly higher.
transcript: 所以我想说的是让我们遵守规则才能飞得更高。

translation: Let us fly freely, and live with rules.
transcript: 让我们自由地飞，有规则地活着。

translation: Thank you.
transcript: 谢谢。
